meanings.definition: To establish a connection or relationship again.
meanings.sent1: After moving away, I wanted to reconnect with my old friends.
meanings.sent2: I plan to reconnect with my family members during the holidays.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reconnect with my lost sock felt like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: The old friends finally managed to reconnect like long-lost siblings.
meanings.sent5: The broken puzzle pieces fit perfectly to reconnect the picture.

meanings.definition: To reestablish communication or contact with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I need to reconnect with my pen pal from another country.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut was excited to reconnect with mission control after the blackout.
meanings.sent3: My phone decided to reconnect with the Wi-Fi at the most inconvenient time.
meanings.sent4: The lost hiker was relieved to finally reconnect with the search team.
meanings.sent5: The detective managed to reconnect the clues to solve the mystery.
